001package tictactoe;
002
003/**
004 * Represents a read-only 2D game board.
005 * 
006 * @author Tapio Malmberg
007 */
008public class ImmutableGameBoard {
009    /**
010     * The squares of the game board.
011     */
012    protected int[][] board;
013
014    /**
015     * Creates a new ImmutableGameBoard with the given width and height.
016     * @param width the width of the game board, must be greater than zero
017     * @param height the height of the game board, must be greater than zero
018     */
019    public ImmutableGameBoard(int width, int height) {
020        if(width <= 0)
021            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Width must be greater than zero.");
022        if(height <= 0)
023            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Height must be greater than zero.");
024
025        board = new int[height][width];
026    }
027
028    /**
029     * Creates a new ImmutableGameBoard from an ImmutableGameBoard
030     * subclass without copying data.
031     * @param other the other ImmutableGameBoard
032     */
033    protected ImmutableGameBoard(ImmutableGameBoard other) {
034        board = other.board;
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Returns the width of the game board.
039     * @return the width of the game board
040     */
041    public int getWidth() {
042        return board[0].length;
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * Returns the height of the game board.
047     * @return the height of the game board
048     */
049    public int getHeight() {
050        return board.length;
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Checks if the given Coordinate is within the game board.
055     * @param pos the coordinate to test
056     * @return true if the given coordinate is within the game board
057     */
058    public boolean isWithinBounds(Coordinate pos) {
059        return isWithinBounds(pos.x, pos.y);
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Checks if the given (x, y) coordinate is within the game board.
064     * @param x the x value of the coordinate
065     * @param y the y value of the coordinate
066     * @return true if the given coordinate is within the game board
067     */
068    public boolean isWithinBounds(int x, int y) {
069        return (x >= 0 && x < getWidth()) && (y >= 0 && y < getHeight());
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Returns the content of the square at the given Coordinate.
074     * @param pos the coordinate of the square to get
075     * @return the content of the square at the coordinate
076     */
077    public int getPosition(Coordinate pos) {
078        return getPosition(pos.x, pos.y);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Returns the content of the square at the given (x, y) coordinate.
083     * @param x the x value of the coordinate
084     * @param y the y value of the coordinate
085     * @return the content of the square at the coordinate
086     */
087    public int getPosition(int x, int y) {
088        return board[y][x];
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Returns the number of adjacent pieces of the given type in the given direction,
093     * starting from the given coordinate.
094     * 
095     * <p>If {@code includeStartPos} is set to true, the starting position {@code pos}
096     * will be included in the test.</p>
097     * @param pos the Coordinate of the starting position
098     * @param dir the direction that will be moved to
099     * @param type the type of square contents that must be matched
100     * @param includeStartPos whether the starting position is included 
101     * @return the number of adjacent pieces in the given direction
102     */
103    public int getNumAdjacent(Coordinate pos, Direction dir, int type, boolean includeStartPos) {
104        int nAdjacent = 0;
105
106        if(!includeStartPos) {
107            pos = pos.move(dir);
108        }
109
110        while(isWithinBounds(pos) && getPosition(pos) == type) {
111            ++nAdjacent;
112            pos = pos.move(dir);
113        }
114
115        return nAdjacent;
116    }
117}
